posts.post_content:
Could you sacrifice Storm Crow to complete your mission?
  
Could you watch it die?
  
Storm Crow is your shield, Storm Crow is your sword.
  
Storm Crow has defied Gods and Demons.
  
MTG Players, I can't tell you everything. It isn't safe. R&D...they know I'm in the system.
  
Inside the Storm Crow deck, there's a solution. A way to stop the Chimney Imps, without summoning the remaining Storm Crows.
  
You will become the Storm Crow-est we can make you.
  
You will be the protectors of MTG and all her subsequent expansions.
  
Don't make a Storm Crow a promise, if you know you can't keep it.
  
Unleash the Storm Crow!
  
One Storm Crow to bring them all, one Storm Crow to find them. One Storm Crow to rule them all, and in the darkness, bind them.
  
In place of Wizards of the Coast you shall have a Storm Crow, not dark but blue and only two converted mana cost. With great artwork and flying, and it's amazingly a 1/2! All share love Storm Crow and despair...
  
Your overconfidence in Storm Crow is your weakn... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Could you sacrifice Storm Crow to complete your mission?
Could you watch it die?
Storm Crow is your shield, Storm Crow is your sword.
Storm Crow has defied Gods and Demons.
MTG Players, I can't tell you everything. It isn't safe. R&D...they know I'm in the system.
Inside the Storm Crow deck, there's a solution. A way to stop the Chimney Imps, without summoning the remaining Storm Crows.
You will become the Storm Crow-est we can make you.
You will be the protectors of MTG and all her subsequent expansions.
Don't make a Storm Crow a promise, if you know you can't keep it.
Unleash the Storm Crow!
One Storm Crow to bring them all, one Storm Crow to find them. One Storm Crow to rule them all, and in the darkness, bind them.
In place of Wizards of the Coast you shall have a Storm Crow, not dark but blue and only two converted mana cost. With great artwork and flying, and it's amazingly a 1/2! All share love Storm Crow and despair...

posts.post_content: Kills quicker than [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) and [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall), cheaper than [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence), stronger than [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), both in power and toughness. A lot of the time it's bigger than [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf), and he doesn't fly! Also great combo material: equip it with [Umezawa's Jitte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Umezawa's Jitte), attack and then [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk)! Get four now!
posts.html:
Kills quicker than Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall, cheaper than Necropotence, stronger than Birds of Paradise, both in power and toughness. A lot of the time it's bigger than Tarmogoyf, and he doesn't fly! Also great combo material: equip it with Umezawa's Jitte, attack and then Time Walk! Get four now!

Posted By: Falos (4/4/2010 3:31:03 AM)

posts.post_content:
Storm Crow was a card that p\*\*\*ed under the radar for awhile. But then, pros just discovered how much insane card advantage he provides. Quickly realizing the mistake they had made, Wizards decided to ban Skullclamp and Fastbond, to try to keep the broken CDWs (Crow Deck Wins) from dominating the metagame.   
  
Protip: Run 4.  
  
Another protip: If you don't have islands, splash blue so you can run 4.
posts.html:
Storm Crow was a card that p***ed under the radar for awhile. But then, pros just discovered how much insane card advantage he provides. Quickly realizing the mistake they had made, Wizards decided to ban Skullclamp and Fastbond, to try to keep the broken CDWs (Crow Deck Wins) from dominating the metagame.

Protip: Run 4.

Another protip: If you don't have islands, splash blue so you can run 4.

posts.post_content: @Paleopaladin First off, that's an awesome username. I think the big reason this card heralds so many jokes is the shear fact of its mediocrity. It just happened to be the card that was so good at being average, it got made fun of. You either call it bad in comparison to utterly horrible cards to get some people to scratch their heads at your comment or you call it amazing for the likewise result. I think the point was simply to confuse and people caught on and spread the confusion.
